Title: Sr. Technical Program Manager
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
At Peloton, we view Platform as a Product. A great platform unlocks speed of development and learning. It allows us to scale easily, enabling our engineers to increase attention to new features and capabilities.  A key to crafting a great platform is data-driven insights and understanding where we should focus our attention to create the best outcomes for our members.  Platform at Peloton is a force-multiplier that enables Peloton to move faster and scale safely with minimal effort. Core to this mission is creation of the best developer experience in the tech industry for the entire spectrum of Peloton's technology.  We work across an incredible variety of technology domains: hardware, firmware, web, mobile, backend, data, messaging, content, streaming, and machine learning. We get to apply these to build a platform of products loved by millions of customers all over the world. 
We are seeking a Senior Technical Program Manager (TPM) to drive planning, project execution, and development of large-scale, cross-team initiatives.   As a Senior Technical Program Manager for Platform, you will have the opportunity to work across many domains: developer experience, core & data infrastructure, reliability engineering, and more. You will lead many exciting projects, ranging from helping us move to a microservices architecture to implementing best-in-class offering in database-as-a-service, service meshes, and API gateways. You will have the opportunity to also support our emerging work in open source and tech learning.
 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON


Be the glue that helps the team get things done including applying agile best practices, running meetings and collecting requirements, and coordinating larger planning activities across our teams


Help organize projects by creating project plans, identifying constraints, providing mitigation plans, and reporting status to key stakeholders


Coordinate across team lines to manage, track and deliver outcomes for our teams while managing trade-offs


Provide visibility by holding the responsibility for regular reporting to key stakeholders on project and program status


Engage in service capacity planning, demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning with our engineers


Track and drive improvements in quality and reliability by analyzing incidents and failure as part of a continual improvement process across our engineering organization


 
YOU BRING TO PELOTON

5+ years of experience in software engineering and/or technical program management

Creative technical problem-solving with proven agile planning, with a track record of getting things done

Experience working with large distributed systems in critical production service environments
Experience in event/incident/problem/change management
Experience with collaboration tools like JIRA, Confluence, and Asana
Familiarity with tools and standar methodologies around developer tooling, cloud technologies, or data infrastructure
Platform-thinking and customer-centric approach
Nice to have:  Experience with AWS Cloud Compute, Kurbernetes, and Datastores

Title: Sr. Manager, Member Support
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are seeking an experienced Senior Manager, Member Support Operations to join our globally diverse and talented team based onsite in Plano, Texas working from our Peloton Plano Headquarters. This pivotal leadership role within our Global Member Support organization is designed for an accomplished leader who can elevate Pelotons Member Support Operations, ensuring an exceptional and seamless Member experience at every touchpoint.
As a Senior Manager, you will oversee the tactical execution and delivery of the high level of service expected by the business. Your focus will be on ensuring that the Member Support team operates efficiently, effectively, and in alignment with Pelotons standards, while driving continuous improvement in the service and support experience. This position requires a dynamic leader with a proven track record of building high-performing teams, delivering results in a fast-paced environment, and managing through complexity and scale.
Peloton Members look to us as experts to guide them with empathy, authenticity, and expertisewhether troubleshooting issues, navigating product features, or maximizing their workout experience. This position may require minimal travel (5%-10%) to collaborate with teams, attend strategic meetings, and engage in events to support organizational goals.
 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Tactical Leadership: Define and execute the operational direction for the Member Support Operations team, ensuring alignment with Pelotons broader goals and priorities.
Operational Excellence: Drive continuous improvement in the service and support experience by implementing refined processes and methodologies that enhance efficiency and Member satisfaction.
Data-Driven Decision Making: Analyze and leverage OKRs, KPIs, metrics, and targets to create and execute actionable strategies that drive operational improvements and elevate the Member experience.
Performance Management: Build a culture of high performance by setting clear goals, organizing teams to maximize productivity, and driving achievement of business objectives.
Team Development: Provide leadership, coaching, and mentorship to managers and team members, focusing on career development, continuous learning, and retention.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with internal and external stakeholders to ensure alignment and seamless communication on support-related initiatives.
Member Experience Advocacy: Act as a champion for the Member, applying expertise to identify and resolve complex business issues, reduce friction, and deliver a consistently elevated experience.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Leadership Expertise: 5+ years of progressive management experience, including 5+ years leading teams in a medium to large call center or customer service environment.
Strategic Mindset: Proven ability to think strategically while driving day-to-day operations, with a focus on optimizing processes and improving Member satisfaction.
Analytical Acumen: Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and make data-driven decisions to enhance Member support operations.
Team Builder: Demonstrated success in building, motivating, and retaining high-performing teams while fostering a people-first, collaborative culture.
Operational Mastery: Deep understanding of contact center operations, including workforce planning, quality assurance, and process optimization.
Action-Oriented: A hands-on leader who takes initiative, executes effectively, and inspires teams to perform at their best.
Communication Skills: Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels.
Adaptability: Thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with a focus on continuous improvement and innovation.
Commitment to Excellence: Passion for delivering exceptional service and a relentless drive to enhance the Member experience.

Title: Program Manager, Commercial Experience
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Commercial Experience Program Manager at Peloton is responsible for ensuring our commercial customers, and their exercisers, have a great experience with Peloton! This role has an opportunity to work across many cross-functional teams that will drive highly visible projects aiming to improve the commercial experience. They will collaborate with teams such as Product, engineering, sales, legal, accounting and more to build a business case, conduct discovery, scope and deliver key programs in line with strategic goals. This person will work cross-departmentally with partners at all levels, including senior management, to successfully deliver strategic programs.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Identify ideas and initiatives that will improve the quality and experience of utilizing Peloton equipment in commercial spaces
Lead large and small scale cross-functional projects in a matrixed environment
Ensure all team members understand the business value and goals tied to the effort
Advocate for the commercial customer, bringing the commercial POV to new and existing initiatives and products
Prepare and manage project plans &amp; project status score cards as well as related meetings
Identify, communicate, and resolve dependencies, risks, and issues
Proactively identify and raise risks and issues to key stakeholders; collaborate with teams to develop mitigation and resolution plans
Work closely with Product and systems teams to ensure the commercial perspective is represented in their roadmaps
Monitor and measure data, deriving insights that determine the success of past programs and inform new potential programs that will improve commercial experience metrics

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

4+ years experience in B2B strategic program management, operations or consulting
2+ years of experience leading software, hardware or customer success focused change programs with complex systems and global reach
You are self-motivated, willing to take action, pragmatic, and intellectually curious
An excellent communicator, both written and orally; experienced in creating communications and presentations for multiple levels of staff and executives regularly
You are comfortable with ambiguity and running with a problem to identify both short term and long term solutions
Ability to speak and translate between technical and non-technical business partners
Track record of successfully carrying out program and project management across post sales or customer success focused initiatives
Ability to foster and build a collaborative working relationship with various stakeholders
Ability to manage constantly evolving priorities in a fast-paced environment and lead teams through change while maintaining a can-do mentality
Fitness industry or Peloton product knowledge is a plus

Peloton Studios delivers both a broad offering of highly engaging subscription content and world-class member classes, events and activations to our members. We are looking for passionate, customer service-driven individuals to ensure an outstanding experience throughout the entire member journey when visiting our studios. This person should excel working in a fast-paced environment, is organized, a self-starter with the ability to work well with others and contribute to a welcoming and inclusive workplace. This is a great opportunity for someone who is motivated, strives to go above and beyond, and is able to deliver the highestlevel of member experience.

Provide the highest level of customer service and experience to members, prospective members, and guests when they arrive and whilst they are within the studio

Working cohesively with other studio departments to ensure a streamlined production experience
Maintain product knowledge and keep updated about the brand
Be flexible to support in any additional studio activations or duties outside of our member class offering, including but not limited to event support, group and corporate bookings.

Title: Sr. Manager, Support Knowledge and Content
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
At Peloton, we are seeking a Senior Manager of Support Knowledge and Content to transform our member support services with expert knowledge management, onsite at our Plano, Texas office. This role is crucial for driving enhancements in our support center's effectiveness and boosting the overall member experience. You will take charge of optimizing our service delivery by developing and maintaining critical resources such as chatbots, internal knowledge articles, macros, self-service tools, and managing our internal department communications. Collaborating with our Service Design team and cross-functional partners, you will ensure that our strategies remain aligned with evolving policies and business changes. 
As a leader within the Member Support team, you will champion the adoption of knowledge management best practices, mentoring your colleagues and team to ensure information is both accessible and user-friendly. Your strategic vision will be essential, but your willingness to engage directly with the challenges will truly set you apart. You are committed to nurturing an environment that values continuous learning and proactive knowledge sharing, all aimed at creating exceptional experiences for our members. You will be crucial in developing and executing our strategy in Member Support for documentation, internal department communications, the use of AI both internally and externally facing. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Strategic Leadership and Implementation: Spearhead the development and execution of strategic knowledge management initiatives that enhance the effectiveness of our support services and improve the overall member experience. Ensure these strategies incorporate the latest in self-service technology, internal knowledge bases, and AI tooling. 
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Lead cross-functional teams in integrating knowledge management practices into day-to-day support operations, ensuring content is accurate, timely, and effective. 
Knowledge Base Management: Oversee our internal and member-facing knowledge base, optimizing content to facilitate self-service solutions and enhance member satisfaction. Mentor team members to maintain high standards in knowledge creation, sharing, and management. 
System Development and Coordination: Define the specifications for knowledge, communication, and process documentation systems and oversee their implementation, working closely with technical teams to ensure seamless integration and functionality. 
Performance Metrics and Reporting: Establish and monitor key performance indicators for knowledge management activities, regularly reporting on their impact to inform ongoing strategy adjustments. 
Stakeholder Engagement: Engage with stakeholders and subject matter experts across the organization to gather insights into customer and employee needs, driving continuous improvements and ensuring alignment with business objectives.
Leadership and Mentoring: Mentor and lead a team of specialized Knowledge Base Content Analysts, who will maintain and update content, execute strategy, and support the delivery of service. 

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

5-7 years of experience in program management or knowledge management within a support or customer experience organization, preferably in the technology industry.
Practical experience applying and implementing Knowledge Centered Service (KCS) principles and practices. 
Previous experience building and supporting Generative AI chatbots, bonus for experience using Ada. 
Demonstrated experience in using Gen. AI tooling and building self-service knowledge bases 
2+ years of experience building Knowledge bases in Salesforce 
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders to achieve business results. 
Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly, staying abreast of emerging trends. 
German language speaking skills a plus 
High levels of emotional intelligence (EQ), empathy, and proactivity, with the ability to lead cross-functional teams through influence.

Title: Sr. Manager, People Strategy and Operations
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLEReady to shape the future of fitness and wellness? At Peloton, we're not just revolutionizing how millions experience fitness and wellness, we're building a world-class People team to support our incredible employees. As Sr. Manager, People Strategy and Operations, you'll be a driving force behind that mission. You'll lead a high-performing team of project managers, optimize our People operations, and deliver strategic initiatives that have an impact at scale. If you're a passionate leader with a knack for operational excellence and a desire to make a real impact, this role is for you. This isn't just another job; it's an opportunity to help shape an iconic brand that genuinely transforms lives. Here, your success isnt measured by what you can accomplish alone, but by how many others you help achieve their best.
The Strategy + Operations team within the People function at Peloton ensures our People team runs smoothly, measures its success, and drives meaningful change. As our Sr. Manager, you'll report to the Sr. Director, Strategy and Operations and lead the People PMO team.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Measure our impact: Monitor key success measures and milestones to ensure we identify risks, implement improvements, measure progress and celebrate successes.

Refine our OKRs and KPIs to provide insights into team and department performance and Impact.
Support the People Leadership team in delivering and refining Quarterly Business Reviews QBRs.
Collaborate with the People Analytics team to ensure the department has access to the data it needs and can leverage insights to drive improvements.


Drive change: Deliver on strategic projects to support Pelotons trajectory

Oversee the department's strategic plan, including progress reviews, initiative evaluations, priority reviews, resource allocation discussions, and lessons learned.
Oversee the People team's project portfolio, managing intake, prioritization, and progress reporting.
Lead and support a team of high-performing project managers to deliver key projects.
Directly lead priority initiatives and influence others through scoping and change management.


Run business operations: Ensure that all team members feel connected, providing opportunities for development, alignment and community.

Manage the resources of the department, including support from other teams, to deliver initiatives related to development, communication and engagement. This may include:

Facilitating access to external expertise and educational opportunities to support Development
Leading regular communication within the department, including monthly Town Halls and newsletters to the company
Establishing regular hybrid and remote-friendly events, celebrations and moments ofrecognition





YOU BRING TO PELOTON

You have 6 years of directly applicable experience.
You've worked in HR previously. You do not need to be an expert in all HR disciplines, but you have a curious mind. Youre not afraid to ask questions and get your hands dirty
You have successfully led high-profile cross-functional projects in the past and managed other PMs to do the same. You have experience getting the best out of teams.
You have a passion for design-thinking and centering the user experience.
Ideally, youve had exposure to or worked in business operations. You do not need to have a linear path, but you do need to understand what excellence looks like when operating a business.
Youre equally comfortable managing up and influencing without authority as you are delegating
You're self-aware, understanding your strengths and how to improve your areas of growth.
You have the capacity to switch between high-level strategic thinking and detailed execution, using your judgment to determine the appropriate approach. Communication at all levels is a strength.
You understand the power of data and how to leverage it to make better decisions.
You're fearless and action-oriented. You are unafraid to take risks and ask for permission later.
Youre committed to inclusion and seek out diverse perspectives, ensuring all team members feel a sense of belonging and connection.
You handle sensitive and confidential information with integrity.
Youre based in commutable distance to New York City and comfortable coming into our Hudson Yards offices three-days/week.

Title: Data Analyst
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Enterprise Data Analytics team at Peloton is looking for a passionate and strategic-minded Data Analyst to join our growing team. This person will contribute to key projects that enhance visibility into key enterprise metrics and drive action based on the resulting insights. They will partner closely with teams across the company to understand their problems and design datasets that can provide actionable insights in a scalable and sustainable way. They will communicate findings and implications for stakeholders from various functions. This person will report to the Manager of Analytics.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Work with members across the Marketing and Peloton for Business organizations to translate their challenges into innovative data solutions
Architect performant, accurate, and scalable data models using dbt and LookML using DRY (dont repeat yourself) principles
Design self-service data products that make datasets accessible and intuitive to a broad group of data consumers
Set up tests to ensure data quality, supervise daily job execution, and diagnose/fix issues to ensure SLAs are met with internal stakeholders
Identify and investigate emerging trends and anomalies in key performance indicators
Balance requests and strategic initiatives to prioritize work based on impact for the business
Clearly articulate and communicate findings to stakeholders across functional groups to influence actions and decisions that advance the companys strategic goals

At Peloton, weve invested in a modern data tech stack (Redshift, Airbyte, Airflow, dbt, Looker) and a world-class data team. If youre passionate about using the best technology and being part of a growing team that values teamwork, proactivity, disciplined decision-making, and knowledge sharing, wed love to hear from you.
YOU BRING TO PELOTON

3+ years of relevant business intelligence or analytics development experience
Experience building Looker data models (LookML), data pipeline management technologies with dependency checking (e.g. Airflow, dbt), schema design, and dimensional data modeling
Skilled at finding trends in the data, articulating the so what, and translating insights into strategic, actionable recommendations.
Ability to anticipate follow-up questions and incorporate them into analysis to address the core problem, not just the direct question.
An open and adaptable mindset and a strong team player (no job is too small or too large) and willing to take on additional responsibilities as necessary.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment where priorities are often shifting.
Experience creating dashboards and self-service capabilities for stakeholders through reporting tools (Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Understanding of SQL, columnar databases, and distributed file systems.
Ability to optimize queries and pipelines for efficient performance.
Experience building data transformations with dbt or equivalent software
Experience applying statistical techniques to understand and quantify the relationships between metrics and differentiate between correlation and causation.
Working knowledge of python, especially libraries and packages focused on data processing and analysis

Title: Sr. FATP Supplier Quality Engineer - Contractor
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Sr. FATP Supplier Quality Engineer - Contractor will be focused on our component supply. This position is critical for ensuring the delivery of quality components from established suppliers and developing new suppliers to meet Pelotons quality requirements. You will manage all quality-related communication between Peloton and suppliers to manufacturing and distribution centers. As a main technical interface for our component suppliers, you will be responsible for driving problem-solving accountability (8Ds), reviewing and approving the implementation of process/part changes, and identifying opportunities for continuous improvement. You will be the responsible escalation point for internal and field concerns regarding component quality. As an individual, you are independent, highly motivated, super organized, hyper-flexible, and enjoy working in a collaborative team environment to protect and improve product quality.
*Location: Chonburi, Thailand
 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Quality Systems: Maintain and improve company quality management systems (QMS) in compliance with applicable regulatory & Peloton requirements related to control of processes and product.
Management: Responsible for representing overseas quality team onsite, training, and ongoing support of staff. Required to effectively communicate project goals to Suppliers. Provide technical guidance and training (mentorship) to suppliers to their ongoing development to reach company goals. manage supplier audit program and suggest new suppliers to audit.
Product Development: Be a key member of the Peloton product development team onsite representing the Supplier Quality function. Steer and support the design control aspects of product quality, program management, and quality planning from product design through manufacturing. Assess, support and process supplier approvals and re-approvals in the approved supplier list (ASL).
Process Verification and Validation: Provide input regarding appropriate statistical methods, test facilities and equipment. This can include process validation, equipment installation/operational qualification, etc.
Production: May develop and implement quality inspection procedures including sampling plans, for production level components, sub-assemblies and finished goods. May also be responsible for the development and implementation of inspection methodologies, fixtures, measurement systems and calibration of such. Monitor, support and resolve production related quality issues with material suppliers.
Auditing: Responsible for overall audit program execution. Developing, implementing, and auditing risk-based annual quality control audit plans and schedules. Conduct and lead supplier, internal and external GMP(Good Manufacturing Practice) and ISO compliance audits. supports production line qualification initiatives, continuous improvement, and regulatory compliance across all supplier sites. Reports results and recommendations for changes as required. Confirms acceptable follow up action on audits. Monitors performance to audit schedules, execution, reporting and audit finding closures within established audit plans and timelines.
Documentation: Create, review, and approve controlled documents on an electronic document control system (e.g. supplier audit plans and reports, nonconformance reports, Quality Manual, work instructions, quality specifications, engineering specifications, lot history and device master records, procedures and validation protocols and reports, etc.). Generate and complete supplier records for approvals in the ASL.
Training: Coordinates and/or provides training to staff in GMP/ISO, Quality Systems, Supplier Quality, and Safety awareness. Provides ongoing development and maintenance of training materials and records.
Compliance: Ensures compliance with company quality policies and practices by participating in product and material reviews, assist in troubleshooting problems related to the manufacture, testing, validation and documentation. May be responsible for aspects of MRB, corrective actions, process control, complaints, document control, calibration & preventive maintenance programs and product/process/equipment validation activities.
Work with Peloton Quality Control team to develop and implement inspection and escalation plans
Coordinate disposition and cost recovery for non-conforming material from suppliers
Drive supplier root cause analysis and corrective actions (8D) and validate results ensuring proper closed-loop corrective action process
Report weekly on defect rate and quality issues
Participate in Continuous Improvement activities to drive improved part design, cost reduction, and yield improvement
Drive JDM/CM accountability and facilitate communication with Peloton Management
Track and provide updates on Quality issues
Manage monthly Quality review meetings with JDM/CM.

 
YOU BRING TO PELOTON

5+ years of experience working as a supplier quality engineer in a similar fast-paced industry
Education in Engineering/Manufacturing
Demonstrated experience in robust supplier quality and applied knowledge with ISO9001, IATF16949, APQP, SPC, MSA, FMEA, QOS, PPAP, 8D
Robust understanding of 2D drawings and GD&T
Experience with CAD tools (Solidworks knowledge is a plus)
Capable to perform Gage R&R, capability studies
Lean/Six Sigma, Green or Black Belt a plus
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written)
Ability to identify bottlenecks in a process and drive improvement

RoleDescription:
The Role
At Peloton, we connect the world through fitness. We are seeking a strategic leader to join our senior leadership team as Vice President of Supply Chain, overseeing three critical areas in North America: Final Mile Delivery for CFUs (Connected Fitness Units), such as treadmills, bikes, and rowers, Service & Repair strategy and execution, and Field Quality. Location preference is in our Plano, Texas office but also open to our New York, NY office, both following a hybrid schedule. 
In this high-impact role, you will define and implement strategies that directly influence Pelotons Member experience, operational efficiency, and business growth. You will drive operational excellence, prioritizing safety, satisfaction, efficiency, and quality to deliver a best-in-class Member experience. This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of Pelotons supply chain operations and elevate our Members fitness journey to new heights.
Your Responsibilities

Final Mile Delivery

Lead Pelotons North American final mile delivery network, ensuring a seamless, premium Member experience through strong partnerships with logistics providers.
Monitor and improve KPIs, including Member satisfaction, cost per delivery, and inventory accuracy, using data-driven insights to achieve operational excellence.
Collaborate with Supply Planning, IT, Manufacturing, and Refurbishment teams to ensure seamless delivery capacity planning and execution.


Service & Repair

Design and execute innovative strategies that ensure first-time resolution for service and repair operations, minimizing downtime for Members and maximizing satisfaction.
Build and manage relationships with external service providers to ensure performance aligns with Pelotons high standards.
Leverage analytics to identify trends, optimize cost efficiency, and drive continuous improvement.


Field Quality

Lead proactive quality control efforts across field operations, ensuring Peloton products meet rigorous durability and reliability standards.
Use insights to drive preventative measures and implement proactive solutions to enhance Member satisfaction and product quality.


Leadership & Operational Excellence

Build and develop a high-performing team, fostering a culture of accountability, adaptability, and continuous learning.
Serve as a thought leader on industry trends, driving operational innovations that enhance Member outcomes and business results.
Instill a culture of safety and ensure compliance with all health, safety, and environmental regulations.



Your Daily Impact

Define and implement department OKRs, aligning team efforts to deliver measurable results on time and within budget.
Build and execute data-driven strategies that optimize performance, reduce costs, and enhance the Member experience.
Oversee external relationships with third-party service providers, ensuring program success and continuous improvement.
Drive innovation through operational strategies that incorporate industry trends and emerging technologies.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement, sustainability, and employee engagement, creating an environment where teams thrive.

Title: Data Scientist, Product Analytics
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is seeking a Data Scientist on the Product Analytics team to support the innovation, iteration, and optimization of our engagement products! This Data Scientist, Product will work as part of a cross-functional team of Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and User Researchers to better understand how members are interacting with Peloton products and to inform and evaluate new features and experiences developed by the Product team. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON 


Own analytics for one core workstream on Peloton digital apps, from metrics definition and data instrumentation design to ongoing reporting, investigation, and generative research 


Be a key contributor to strategic decisions and roadmap formation for workstream


Collaborate with Product Managers, User Researchers, Designers, and Engineers to lead experimentation processes: designing and measuring A/B tests that help us understand the impact of new/alternate versions of features on user behavior


Define and own reporting and interpretation of KPIs & metrics for workstream, feature launches and A/B tests


Develop a deep understanding of user personas, fitness routines, and retention drivers for our members


Evaluate engagement trends across markets - compare workout/content engagement and feature usage among members within our growing global community


Become an authority on your workstream: provide insight into behaviors and difficulties of members on their journey from app download through sustained long-term engagement; help guide roadmap and evaluation of new features to enhance this user journey


Work in a lean and agile way, focusing on team members' desired outcomes over granular tasks and continuously assessing tradeoffs between precision and action-ability


YOU BRING TO PELOTON


BA/BS degree, preferably in a technical field


Have 3+ years of overall experience in an analytics capacity with a focus on problem-solving and providing concrete insights; some experience conducting analysis with a product/UX focus is desirable (an advanced degree may supply to years of experience)


Have solid technical skills when it comes to data wrangling and handling large datasets: can use SQL for data extraction (including sophisticated joins, CTE, window functions and query optimization), and have a proven understanding of Python syntax required for data cleaning and exploratory analysis (e.g. pandas, numpy)


Have experience with A/B testing and have demonstrated experience designing and assessing experiments


Have an understanding of statistics and data science methodologies (e.g. hypothesis testing, regressions, and other machine learning techniques such as clustering)


Have shown experience defining and owning project success metrics


Have a passion for data storytelling via decks and dashboards and a shown ability to efficiently communicate your insights to non-technical audiences and senior leadership


Are comfortable leading your project timelines, prioritizing tasks with user and business impact in mind, assessing speed/precision tradeoffs, and proactively communicating project statuses to collaborators and teammates


Work well collaboratively, both in a cross-functional context - with Product Managers, Project Managers, User Researchers, Designers, and Engineers - and as a part of joint research projects with Product Analytics teammates


Are curious and humble: ask good questions, are always excited to learn new methods, approaches, and perspectives, and are eager to investigate interesting trends in the data 




Previous experience working on a product analytics team for a B2C software or software+hardware product


Solid understanding of event-based data collection and related technical concepts (e.g. SDK, device vs. cloud mode, schema management) and tools (e.g. Segment)


Experience with product analytics SaaS tools (e.g. Amplitude, Mixpanel, Pendo, etc.)


Experience with social engagement features/products, growth loops, network effects and product virality 


Understanding of adjacent quantitative and qualitative research methods and techniques (e.g. usability testing, concept testing, market sizing, etc.)

Title: SOX ITGC (UAR) Manager
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are seeking a skilled SOX ITGC Manager to lead our Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) compliance efforts with a particular focus on User Access Review (UAR) controls and Identity Governance. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in IT general controls, risk management, and identity management frameworks. This role will be responsible for overseeing and managing the execution of the SOX User Access Review process to ensure compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) regulations and company policies. This role requires a strong understanding of information security principles, regulatory requirements, and the ability to collaborate with external auditors, internal audit teams, and business leaders to ensure robust compliance with SOX controls and effective management of user access reviews. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in SOX compliance, audit management, and cross-functional collaboration.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

SOX Compliance Management:Oversee and manage SOX compliance activities related to IT General Controls (ITGC), ensuring timely execution of UAR and other related controls.
User Access Review (UAR):Design, implement, and monitor UAR processes to ensure that user access is appropriate and complies with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.
Identity Governance:Develop and maintain an identity governance framework to manage user identities, roles, and access rights across systems, ensuring least privilege access principles are adhered to.
Risk Assessment:Conduct regular risk assessments related to ITGC and identity management. Identify potential risks and recommend mitigation strategies to senior management.
Documentation and Reporting:Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all SOX controls, including policies, procedures, and process flows. Prepare and present regular compliance reports to management and auditors.
Collaboration:Work closely with IT teams, internal audit, and external auditors to facilitate audits and ensure compliance with SOX requirements.
Interface with External Auditors:Serve as the primary point of contact for external auditors regarding ITGC and UAR controls, ensuring that all necessary documentation and information are provided in a timely manner.
Training and Awareness:Develop training programs for staff on SOX compliance, UAR controls, and best practices in identity governance to foster a culture of compliance within the organization.
Continuous Improvement:Identify opportunities for process improvements in compliance practices and implement best practices in identity governance.

Qualifications:

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Accounting, or a related field.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in IT compliance, risk management, or audit, with a focus on SOX.
Strong understanding of ITGC frameworks, SOX requirements, and UAR controls.
Experience with identity governance solutions and practices (e.g., IAM, role-based access control).
Familiarity with relevant regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) and industry standards (e.g., ISO 27001).
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex information clearly.
Relevant certifications (e.g., CISA, CISSP, CRISC) are a plus

Title: Senior Engineer, Continuous Improvement & Lean Manufacturing
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Senior Engineer, Operational Excellence & Lean Manufacturing will play a critical role in driving continuous improvement initiatives across Peloton's manufacturing operations. Based in Taichung, Taiwan, this role will focus on collaborating with third-party manufacturers to enhance operational efficiency, reduce waste, and implement lean manufacturing principles to achieve world-class manufacturing standards. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in operational excellence, lean manufacturing, and process improvement, coupled with excellent problem-solving skills and a passion for driving change.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Continuous Improvement:

Lead and facilitate continuous improvement projects using lean manufacturing and Six Sigma methodologies with third-party manufacturers.
Identify, analyze, and eliminate waste in manufacturing processes to improve efficiency and reduce costs.
Develop and implement standard operating procedures (SOPs) to ensure consistency and quality in production.

Lean Manufacturing:

Promote a culture of lean thinking and operational excellence throughout third-party manufacturing partners.
Conduct value stream mapping to identify areas of improvement and streamline production processes.
Implement lean tools and techniques such as 5S, Kaizen, Kanban, and Just-In-Time (JIT) manufacturing.

Operational Excellence KPIs:

Develop, track, and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) related to operational excellence, such as Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE), cycle time, lead time, first pass yield, scrap rate, and downtime.
Set targets and benchmarks for continuous improvement in collaboration with third-party manufacturers.
Utilize KPIs to monitor progress and drive data-driven decision-making to enhance manufacturing performance.

Data Analysis & Reporting:

Utilize data-driven approaches to identify trends, root causes, and opportunities for improvement.
Develop and maintain performance metrics to monitor the effectiveness of improvement initiatives.
Prepare and present reports on operational performance and improvement projects to senior management.

Training & Development:

Train and mentor team members and third-party manufacturers on lean manufacturing principles and continuous improvement methodologies.
Foster a culture of continuous learning and development within the manufacturing team.
Facilitate workshops and training sessions to promote operational excellence.

Collaboration & Leadership:

Work closely with cross-functional teams including production, quality, supply chain, and engineering to drive improvement initiatives.
Provide leadership and guidance to project teams to ensure successful implementation of improvement projects.
Act as a change agent to promote a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence.


YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Bachelors degree in Engineering, Manufacturing, Operations Management, or a related field.
Minimum of 7 years of experience in operational excellence, lean manufacturing, or process improvement roles.
Certified Six Sigma Black Belt or Lean Manufacturing certification required.
Proven track record of leading and implementing continuous improvement projects in a manufacturing environment.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to use data to drive decision-making.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and third-party manufacturers.
Proficiency in using lean manufacturing tools and techniques.
Experience with ERP systems and manufacturing software is a plus.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with a focus on achieving results.
Fluent in Mandarin and English is required.

Title: Advanced Manufacturing Engineer
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Advanced Manufacturing Engineer to join our team in Taichung, Taiwan. The successful candidate will play a critical role in designing and improving final assembly testing and packing (FATP) lines, driving the proper balance between low-cost automation and improving line efficiency from an industrialization point of view. This role requires a strong background in industrial engineering, process optimization, and continuous improvement methodologies. Additionally, the role involves working with third-party manufacturers to design takt times and cycle times, understand line flexibility, and assess the should-cost of manufacturing equipment and manufacturing value added (MVA).
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Line Design and Optimization:

Design, develop, and optimize FATP lines to enhance production efficiency, product quality, and cost-effectiveness, balancing low-cost automation and industrialization requirements.


Collaboration with Third-Party Manufacturers:

Partner with third-party manufacturing partners to ensure adherence to Pelotons quality standards and production timelines in FATP operations.


Takt and Cycle Times:

Design and optimize takt times and cycle times in collaboration with third-party manufacturers to ensure efficient production flow and flexibility.


Cost Assessment:

Understand and assess the should-cost of manufacturing equipment and manufacturing value added (MVA) to ensure cost-effective production processes.


Process Improvement:

Lead continuous improvement initiatives using Lean Manufacturing and Six Sigma principles to identify and eliminate waste, reduce variation, and improve overall FATP line performance.


Industrial Engineering Expertise:

Apply industrial engineering principles to develop efficient workstations, workflows, and assembly processes for FATP, focusing on the balance between automation and manual processes.


Data Analysis and Reporting:

Utilize data-driven approaches to monitor, analyze, and report on FATP line performance metrics. Implement corrective actions as necessary.


New Product Introduction (NPI):

Support the transition of new products from design to final assembly, ensuring that FATP lines are capable of producing at the required quality and volume.


Training and Development: Train and mentor production staff and junior engineers in advanced FATP techniques and continuous improvement methodologies.
Compliance and Safety:

Ensure all FATP processes comply with industry standards and regulations. Promote a culture of safety within the manufacturing environment.



YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Education:

 Bachelors degree in Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, or a related field. English and Mandarin required.


Experience:

Minimum of 5 years of experience in advanced manufacturing engineering, with a focus on designing and improving FATP lines in a high-volume manufacturing environment.


Technical Skills:

Proficiency in CAD/CAM software, knowledge of automated testing systems, and efficient packing methodologies. Familiarity with industrial engineering principles and practices.


Problem-Solving:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proven track record of implementing successful FATP line improvements.


Communication:

Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both English and Mandarin.


Team Player:

Ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Certification:

Lean Six Sigma certification (Green Belt or higher) is preferred.

Title: Senior User Researcher
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE 
Peloton is seeking a Senior User Researcher to support the innovation, iteration, and optimization of our Bike, Tread, and Row hardware. This Senior User Researcher will work directly with Product Managers, Industrial Designers, Mechanical Engineers, and Product Designers to better understand how users are interacting with Peloton hardware products through user research and testing to inform and evaluate new features and experiences developed by the Product teams. This person will also apply their skills to conduct user research on software and the interaction between hardware and software, as needed. This role will work across Peloton Product teams and will report to the Director, User Research. YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON 

Continually evolve our process for organizing User research and testing across multiple Product teams and multiple User Researchers, ensuring appropriate prioritization of projects, and crafting and managing short- and long-term research plans. 
Collaborate with Product Managers, Industrial designers, and Engineers to identify hardware user research goals based on ambiguous problem statements, and then scope, plan, and execute research to address those goals.

Conduct qualitative and quantitative research using a range of tools and approaches (e.g. interviews, ethnography, card sorting, surveys) to answer user research questions and produce new insights. 
Help to formulate research documentation to better understand Peloton-specific user behavior.  Document and track findings gathered through testing and research so insights can easily be referenced and applied for future projects. 

WHAT YOU BRING TO PELOTON 

5+ years of User Research and Testing experience
Experience planning, coordinating, and conducting hardware and software user research  Experience writing and conducting user interviews

Exceptional communication and storytelling skills 
Self Starter; ability to act autonomously 
Constant attention to detail 
Can provide work samples focused on User Research and Testing

Bonus: Experience writing, fielding and analyzing quantitative surveys
